channel.title: IncomingPackets Error
channel.description:
Problem: [code]client.java:9032: code too large public void parseIncomingPackets(){ ^[/code]
Server Base: Project 16V4.5
how do i fix this? (Don't tell me to shorten down the code)

item.title: IncomingPackets Error
item.dc:creator: @Mrquarter Mrquarter
item.description:
@Mrquarter wrote:

here you go.

[b]Purpose: To fix the code to large error

Difficulty: 2-10

Assumed Knowledge: Should know how to search and fix errors.

Server Base: Br4scape that is an edited Cheezscape 80

Classes Modified: Client.Java

NOTES: 1-FOR THIS TO WORK YOU MUST ADD A NEW CASE IN THE NEW PACKETS OR JUST COPY YOUR SELECTED CASE IN THE FIRST PACKET DELETE IT AND PASTE IT ON THE SECOND PACKET MAKING IT WORK AND SAVING LOTS OF SPACE.IF YOU DO THIS WRONG YOULL GET CONNECTION LOST EVRY TIME YOU DO ANOTHER THING THAT IS IN THE 1ST PACKET(its important, thats why it is in caps)

2-This is the easiest way[/b]

Procedure

Step 1: Search for

public void parseIncomingPackets()

and above it add these

[CODE]public void parseIncomingPackets2()
{
int i;
int junk;
int junk2;
int junk3;

	switch (packetType)
            {[/CODE]

Step 2: Go up your client and search for

parseIncomingPackets();

Step 3: Above it add

parseIncomingPackets2();

Enjoy.

Read full topic
